metadata.title: CVE-2023-24021 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect handling of '\0' bytes in file uploads in ModSecurity before2.9.7 may allow for Web Application Firewall bypasses and buffer over-readson the Web Application Firewall when executing rules that read theFILES_TMP_CONTENT collection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-24021` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-security2 - 2.9.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: modsecurity-apache package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.5-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
